com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCLabelBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseBindingData
      • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCLabelBindingData

  • public class YRCLabelBindingData
extends YRCBaseBindingData
    Instances of this class provide binding, behavioral and name information about label controls.

    An instance of this class holds data for Theme, Image etc. Allows for binding a server image and also contains the image server config name.
    Author:
    vviswanathan
    See Also:
    YRCBaseBindingData, YRCFieldExtension

      • getImageServerConfigName

        public java.lang.String getImageServerConfigName()

      • setServerImageConfiguration

        public void setServerImageConfiguration(java.lang.String imageServerConfigName)
        Method to specify the image server configuration to fetch and display image on the Label. It also specifies that the Label is actually a image displayer and the image is to fetched from the image server. When model is set then the label is updated with the image fetched from the server instead of the text.
        Parameters:
        imageServerConfigName -

      • setServerImageBinding

        public void setServerImageBinding(boolean isServerImageBinding)
        Method to specify that the source binding needs to fetch and display image on the Label from the provided URL. When model is set then the label is updated with the image fetched from the server instead of the text. Applications can use this method specifically to get images from an external server.
        If setServerImageConfiguration(String) is used then this boolean is implicitly set to true.
        Parameters:
        isServerImageBinding - True to indicate that image is fetched from a server.

      • setServerImageWidth

      • getDataType

        public java.lang.String getDataType()
        Returns:
        The data type of the control if the data type is not controlled by target binding.

      • setDataType

        public void setDataType(java.lang.String dataTypeName)
        Set the datatype to be used for validating the text control.

        Note: Usage of this method should be used in special cases only. The datatype can be derived from either, the target or source binding specified for the binding object. Only when the one needs to override the derived datatype from binding, this method be used.
